answerText: Kate Chopin[10] This author wrote one book set amongst the fishing villages of Maine and described Sylvia's refusal to disclose the location of the title bird to a hunter and her subsequent admiration of nature's charms in her best known story.
heading: QUARK |2012 | 1 | 3 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, name some female American authors who wrote short stories. [10] She wrote about a sexual encounter between Alcée and Calixta in her story "The Storm," a theme that she also used in her novel The Awakening. She tackled the problem of race in "Désirée's Baby."
